title: Shrek 2

lines.text: Once upon a time in a kingdom far far away, the king and queen were blessed with a beautiful baby girl. And throughout the land, everyone was happy. Until the sun went down, and they saw that their daughter was cursed with a frightful enchantment that took hold each and every night. Desperate, they sought the help of a fairy godmother; who had them lock the young princess away in a tower, there to await the kiss of the handsome Prince Charming!
It was he who would chance the perilous journey through blistering cold and scorching desert traveling for many days and nights, risking life and limb to reach the Dragonâ€™s Keep.
For he was the bravest...
â€¦and most handsomeâ€¦
...in all the land. And it was destiny that his kiss...
â€¦would break the dreaded curse.
He alone would climb to the highest room of the tallest tower to enter the princessâ€™s chambers, cross the room to her sleeping silhouette, pull back the gossamer curtains to find her--
What?
Princessâ€¦Fiona?
No!
Oh, thank heavens. Where is she?
Sheâ€™s on her honeymoon.
Honeymoon?! With whom?!
Itâ€™s so good to be home!
Just you and me andâ€¦
ðŸŽ¶Two can be as bad as oneâ€¦ðŸŽ¶
Donkey?
Shrek! Fiona! Well arenâ€™t you two a sight for sore eyes! Give us a hug, Shrek, you old love machine. [chuckles] And look at you, Mrs. Shrek. How â€˜bout a side of sugar for the steed?
Donkey, what are you doing here?
Oh! I was just taking care of your love nest for you.
Oh, you mean likeâ€¦ sorting the mail and watering the plants?
Yeah, and feeding the fish!
I donâ€™t have any fish.
You do now. I call that one Shrek and the other Fiona.
That Shrek is a rascally devil. Get yourâ€¦[mumbling]
Oh, would you look at the time? Well I guess youâ€™d better be going.
Hey wait a minute, donâ€™t you want to tell me all about your trip? Or how about a game of Parcheesi?
Um, actually--Donkey? Shouldnâ€™t you be getting home to Dragon?
Oh, yeah, that. I donâ€™t know. Sheâ€™s been all moody and stuff lately...so I thought Iâ€™d move back in with you guys!
Well you know weâ€™re always happy to see you, Donkey.
But Fiona and I are married now. We need a little time, you know, to be together.
Just with each other.
Alone.
Say no more, say no more. You donâ€™t have to worry about a thing. I will always be here to make sure nobody bothers you!
Donkey!
Yes, roomie?
Youâ€™re bothering me.
Oh, okay. All right, cool. I guess uhâ€¦ me and Pinocchio was gonna catch a tournament, anyway, so uh.... maybe Iâ€™ll see yâ€™all Sunday for a barbecue or something.
Heâ€™ll be fine. Now, where were we?
Oh. I think I remember.
Donkey!
I know, I know! Alone! Iâ€™m going! Iâ€™m going! Hey, but what do you want me to tell these other guys?
Enough, Reggie. [clears throat] "Dearest Princess Fiona. You are hereby summoned to the Kingdom of Far, Far Away for a royal ball in celebration of your marriage...
...at which time the King will bestow his royal blessingâ€¦ upon you and yourâ€¦eh...
uhâ€¦Prince Charming. Love, the King and Queen of Far Far Away. A.K.A. Mom and Dad."
Mom and Dad?
Prince Charming?
Royal ball?! Can I come?
Weâ€™re not going.
What?!
What?!
I mean, donâ€™t you think they might be a bitâ€¦ shocked to see you like this?
Well, they might be a bit surprised. But theyâ€™re my parents, Shrek. They love me. And donâ€™t worry, they're gonna love you too.
Yeah, right. Somehow I donâ€™t think Iâ€™ll be welcome at the country club.
Will you stop it? Theyâ€™re not like that.
Then how do you explain Sergeant Pompous and the Fancy Pants Club Band?
Oh, come on! You could at least give them a chance.
To do what? Sharpen their pitchforks?
No! They just want to give you their blessing.
Oh, great. Now I need their blessing?
Well, if you want to be a part of this family, yes!
And who says I want to be part of this family?
Uh, you did! When you married me?!
Well, thereâ€™s some fine print for you!
Ugh! So thatâ€™s it, you wonâ€™t come?
Trust me. Itâ€™s a bad idea. We are not going! And thatâ€™s final!
Hey, come on, Shrek! We donâ€™t want to hit traffic!
Donâ€™t worry! Weâ€™ll take care of everything.
Hey, wait for me! Oof!

ðŸŽ¶Head â€˜em up! Head â€˜em up! Move â€˜em on! Rawhide! Knock â€˜em out! Pound â€˜em dead! Make â€˜em tea! Buy â€˜em drinks! Meet their mamas! Milk â€˜em hard! Rawhide! Yee-haw!ðŸŽ¶
Are we there yet?
No.
Are we there yet?
Not yet.
Okay, are we there yet?
No.
Are we there yet?
No!
Are we there YET?
(sarcastically) Yes.
Really?
NO!
Are we there yet?!
No!
Are we there YET?!
No, we are not!
ARE WE THERE YET?!?!?
NOOOOOOO!!!!!!
NOOOOOOO!!!!!!
Are we there yet? Hey, thatâ€™s not funny. Hey, thatâ€™s really immature. See, this is why nobody likes ogres. Alright, your loss!
Are we there yet? Hey, thatâ€™s not funny. Hey, thatâ€™s really immature. See, this is why nobody likes ogres. Alright, your loss!
Iâ€™m gonna just stop talking!
(sarcastically happy) Finally!
But this is taking forever, Shrek. And there ain't no in-flight movie or nothing!
The Kingdom of Far Far Away, Donkey. Thatâ€™s where weâ€™re going. Far Farâ€¦ [whispers] Away!
All right, all right, I get it. Iâ€™m just so darn bored!
Well, find a way to entertain yourself.
Oh! For five minutes. Could you not be yourself? FOR FIVE MINUTES!!!!
ARE WE THERE YET?!?!
Yes!
Oh, finally!
Wow! Itâ€™s going to be champagne wishes and caviar dreams from now on!
Hey, good-looking! Weâ€™ll be back to pick you up later! Ooh, pantyhose!
We are definitely not in the swamp anymore.
Halt!
Hey, everyone, look!
Hey, ladies! Nice day for a parade, huh? Yeah! You working that hat!
Swimming pools! Movie stars!
Announcing the long-awaited return of the beautiful Princess Fiona and her new husband!
Well, this is it.
This is it.
This is it.
This is it.
Uhâ€¦ why donâ€™t you guys go ahead? Iâ€™ll park the car.
Soâ€¦ (chuckles) ...you still think this was a good idea?
Of course! Look! Mom and Dad look happy to see us.
Who on earth are they?
I think thatâ€™s our little girl.
Thatâ€™s not little! Thatâ€™s a really big problem! Wasnâ€™t she supposed to kiss Prince Charming and break the spell?
Well, heâ€™s no Prince Charming, but they do look--
Happy now? We came. We saw them.
Now letâ€™s go before
Who on earth are they?
I think thatâ€™s our little girl.
Thatâ€™s not little! Thatâ€™s a really big problem! Wasnâ€™t she supposed to kiss Prince Charming and break the spell?
Well, heâ€™s no Prince Charming, but they do look--
Happy now? We came. We saw them.
Now letâ€™s go before they light the torches.
Theyâ€™re my parents!
Hello? They locked you in a tower!
Hey! That was for my own--
Good! Now hereâ€™s our chance. Letâ€™s go back inside and pretend weâ€™re not home!
Harold, we have to be--
Quick! While theyâ€™re not looking we could make a run for it.
Shrek! Stop it! Everythingâ€™s gonna be--
A disaster! There is no way--
You can do this.
I really--
Really--
Really--
Don't--
Want--
To--
Be--
Here!
Mom, Dad. Iâ€™d like you to meet my husbandâ€¦Shrek.
Well, umâ€¦ Itâ€™s easy to see where Fiona gets her good looks from.
Excuse me.
Better out than in, I always say, eh, Fiona?
Thatâ€™s good...
I guess not...
What do you mean, "not on the list"? Donâ€™t tell me you donâ€™t know who I am.
Hey! Whatâ€™s happening, everybody? Thanks for waiting. You know I had the hardest time finding this place.
No! No! Bad donkey! Bad! Down!
No, no, no, Dad! Itâ€™s all right! Itâ€™s all right. Heâ€™s with us. He helped rescue me from the dragon.
Yup, that's me. The noble steed. Hey, waiter! How â€˜bout a bowl for the steed?
Oh, boy...
Um, Shrek?
Yeah?..Oh! Sorry! Great soup, Mrs. Q. Mmm!
No, no. Darling.
Oh!
So, Fiona, tell us about where you live.
Wellâ€¦ Shrek owns his own land. Donâ€™t you, honey?
Oh, yes! Itâ€™s in an enchanted forest abundant in squirrels and... cute little duckies and--
What?! (laughing) I know you ainâ€™t talking about the swamp!
Donkey!
An ogre from a swamp. Oh! How original.
Well, I suppose that would be a fine place to raise the children...
(chuckling) Itâ€™s a bit early to be thinking about that, isnâ€™t it?
Indeed. (sternly) I just started eating.
Harold!
Whatâ€™s that supposed to mean?
Dad. Itâ€™s great, okay?
Well, for his type, yes.
My type?!
Uhhh--I gotta go to the bathroom.
Dinner is served!
Never mind. I can hold it.
Bon appetit!
Ooh, Mexican food! My favorite!
Well, letâ€™s not just sit here with our tummies rumbling. Everybody dig in!
Donâ€™t mind if I do, Lillian.
So, I suppose any grandchildren I could expect from you would be--
Ogres, yes!
Not that thereâ€™s anything wrong with that. Right, Harold?
Oh, no! No! Of course, not! That is, assuming you donâ€™t eat your own young!
Dad!
Oh, no, we usually prefer the ones whoâ€™ve been locked away in a tower!
Shrek, please!
I only did that because I love her!
Oh, aye! Daycare or dragon-guarded castle?!
You wouldnâ€™t understand! Youâ€™re not her father!
Itâ€™s so nice to have the family together for dinner.
Harold!
Shrek!
Fiona!
Fiona!
Mom!
Harold.
Donkey!
Oh! Oh, my dear. Oooh, look at you, you're all um...grown up. [chuckles]
Um, who are you?
Oh, sweet pea! Iâ€™m your Fairy Godmother.
I have a fairy godmother?
Shu-shu-shu--shush, shush. Now, donâ€™t worry. Iâ€™m here to make it all better. With...just...aâ€¦
Stop, please!
Stop!
(chuckles) Look...thank you very much, Fairy Godmother, but I really donâ€™t need all this.
Fiona? Fiona?
Oh! You got a puppy? All I got in my room was shampoo.
Oh...uhâ€¦Fairy Godmother, furnitureâ€¦Iâ€™d like you to meet my husband, Shrek.
Your husband? What--what did you say? When did this happen?
Shrek is the one who rescued me.
But that canâ€™t be right!
Oh, great, more relatives!
Sheâ€™s just trying to help.
Good! She can help us pack. Get your coat, dear. Weâ€™re leaving.
What?
Leaving? I donâ€™t want to leave.
When did you decide this?
Shortly after arriving.
Look, I Iâ€™m sorryâ€¦
No, no, no, no, thatâ€™s all right. I need to go, anyway. But remember, dear, if you should ever need meâ€¦happinessâ€¦is just a teardrop away.
Thanks, but weâ€™ve got all the happiness we need. Happy, happy, happy!
So I see...letâ€™s go, Kyle.
Very nice, Shrek.
What? I told you coming here was a bad idea.
You could've at least tried to get along with my father!
You know, somehow I donâ€™t think I was going to get Daddyâ€™s blessing even if I did want it!
Well, do you think it might be nice if somebody asked me what I wanted?
Sure. Do you want me to pack for you?
You're unbelievable! Youâ€™re behaving like aâ€¦
Go on! Say it!
Like an ogre!
Well, hereâ€™s a news flash for you: whether your parents like it or not, I am an ogre!
And guess what, princess? Thatâ€™s not about to change.
Iâ€™ve made changes for you, Shrek. Think about that.
Thatâ€™s real smooth, Shrek. "Iâ€™m an ogre!" [mimics Shrek roars]
I knew this would happen.
You should. You started it.
I can hardly believe that, Lillian. I mean really, he's the ogre. Not me.
I think, Harold, youâ€™re taking this a little too personally. This is Fionaâ€™s choice.
Yes, but she was supposed to choose the prince we picked out for her! I mean, you expect me to give my blessings to thisâ€¦this...thing?
Fiona does. And sheâ€™ll never forgive you if you donâ€™t. I donâ€™t want to lose our daughter again, Harold.
Ugh, you act as if love is totally predictable. Donâ€™t you remember when we were young? And oh, we used to walk down by the lily pond and they were in bloomâ€¦
Our first kiss... (snapping out of it) itâ€™s not the same! I donâ€™t think you realize that our daughter has married a monster!
Oh, stop being such a drama king.
Fine! Fine! Pretend thereâ€™s nothing wrong! (dances around) La, di, da, di, da, di da! Isnâ€™t it all wonderful! Iâ€™d like to know how it could get any worse!
Hello, Harold.
What happened?
Uh, nothing! Nothing, dear! Just the old crusade wound playing up a bit! [chuckles] Iâ€™ll... just stretch it out here for a while!
...uh, we, we make this a quick visit. What? What?
Oh, hello. Ha-ha-ha!
So, whatâ€™s new?
You remember my son, Prince Charming?
Charming! Oh! Is that you? My gosh! It's been years! How--when...when, when, when did you get back?
Oh, about 5 minutes ago, actually... (angrily) after I endured blistering winds! Scorching deser
Oh, hello. Ha-ha-ha!
So, whatâ€™s new?
You remember my son, Prince Charming?
Charming! Oh! Is that you? My gosh! It's been years! How--when...when, when, when did you get back?
Oh, about 5 minutes ago, actually... (angrily) after I endured blistering winds! Scorching desert! I climbed to the highest room of the tallest towerâ€“-
Mommy can handle this.. (continuing her son's rant) He endures blistering winds and scorching desert! He climbs to the highest bloody room of the tallest bloody tower!
But, but, but...
And what does he find? Some gender-confused wolf telling him that his princess--
If I could just--
--is already married!
I mean, It wasnâ€™t my fault. He didnâ€™t get there in time.
Stop the car!
Harold...
You force me to do something I really donâ€™t want to do.
Where are we?
Well, hi, there! Welcome to Friarâ€™s Fat Boy, may I take your order?
My diet is ruined! I hope youâ€™re happy. (turns to the clerk) Erâ€¦ okay. Two Renaissance Wraps, no mayoâ€¦ chili ring...
Iâ€™ll have the Medieval Meal.
Yeah, one Medieval Meal and Haroldâ€¦ curly fries?
No, thank you.
Sourdough soft taco, then? What do you want?
No, really, Iâ€™m fine.
Your order, Fairy Godmother.
And this comes with the Medieval Meal.
There you are, dear.
You see we made a deal, Harold, and I assume you donâ€™t want me to go back on my part.
Indeed not.
So Fiona and Charming will be together.
Yes.
Oh, believe me, Harold. Itâ€™s whatâ€™s best. Not only for your daughterâ€¦
...but for your Kingdom.
What am I supposed to do about it?
Use your imagination.
Ohâ€¦uh come on in, Your Majesty.
Um, excuse me?
Hey. Do I know you?
Uh, no, you must be mistaking me for someone else. Uhâ€¦ excuse me. Iâ€™m looking for the Ugly Stepsister.
Ah! There you are. Right. You see, I...I need to have someone taken care of .
Whoâ€™s the guy?
Well, heâ€™s not a guy, per se. Umâ€¦ heâ€™s an ogre.
Hey, buddy, let me clue you in. Thereâ€™s only one fella who can handle a job like that, and, franklyâ€¦he don't like to be disturbed.
Where could I find him?
H-Hello?
Who dares enter my room?
Sorry! I hope Iâ€™m not interrupting, but Iâ€™m told youâ€™re the one to talk to about an...ogre problem?
You are told correct, but for this I charge a great deal of money.
Wouldâ€¦ this be enough?
Hmm. You have engaged my valuable services...Your Majesty. Just tell me where I can find this ogre.
Dear knight, I pray that you take this favor as a token of my gratitude.
Dear Diary. Sleeping Beauty is having a slumber party tomorrow, but Dad says I canâ€™t go. He never lets me out after sunset.
Dad says Iâ€™m going away for a while. Must be like some finishing school or something.
Mom says that when Iâ€™m old enough, my Handsome Prince Charming will rescue me from my tower and bring me back to my family!
And we'll all live happily ever after!
Mrs. Fiona Charming.
Sorry. I hope Iâ€™m not interrupting anything.
No, no. I was just reading a, uhâ€¦a scary book.
I was hoping youâ€™d let me apologize for my despicable behavior earlier.
Okay?
I donâ€™t know what came over me. Do you suppose we could pretend it never happened and start over?
Look, Your Majesty, I justâ€¦
Please, call me Dad.
Dad. We both acted like ogres. Maybe we just need some time to get to know each other.
Excellent idea! I was actually hoping you might join me for a morning hunt. A little...father-son time? I know it would mean the world to Fiona.
Shall we say 7:30 by the old oak?
Face it, Donkey! Weâ€™re lost.
We canâ€™t be lost! We followed the kingâ€™s instructions exactly. What did he say? "Head to the darkest part of the woodsâ€¦"
Aye.
"Past the sinister trees with those scary-looking branches."
Check.
Yeah, and thereâ€™s the bush shaped like Shirley Bassey!
We passed that bush 3 times already!
Hey, you were the one who said you didn't want to stop and get directions.

Alright, you donâ€™t have to get huffy with me, Iâ€™m only trying to help.
I know! I know. (sighs) Iâ€™m sorry, all right?
Hey, donâ€™t worry about it.
I just really need to make things work with this guy.
Yeah, sure. Now letâ€™s go bond with Daddy.
Well, well, well, Donkey. I know it was kind of a tender moment back there, but the purring?
Man, what are you talking about? I ainâ€™t purring.
Oh, sure. Whatâ€™s next? A hug?
Hey, Shrek. Donkeys donâ€™t purr. What do you think I am, some kind of aâ€¦
Ha-ha! Fear me, if you dare! (hisses)
Hey, look! A little cat.
Look out, Shrek! He got a piece!
Itâ€™s a cat, Donkey. Come here, little kitty, kitty. Come on, little kitty. Come here. Oh! Come here, little kitty.
Hold on, Shrek! Iâ€™m coming!
Come on! Oh, get it off! Oh, get it off! Oh, God. Ohâ€¦ No! Ooh! Aagh!
Look out, Shrek! Hold still!
Get it off!
Shrek! Hold still!
Did I miss?
No. You got them.
Now, ye ogre, pray for mercy fromâ€¦ Pussâ€¦in Boots !
Ohh, Iâ€™ll kill that cat!
Ah-ha-ha!
Hairball.
Oh! That is nasty!
What do you reckon we should do with him?
I say we take the sword and neuter him right here. Give him the Bob Barker treatment!?

Oh, no! Por favor! Please! I implore you! It was nothing personal, SeÃ±or! I was doing it only for my family. My mother, she is sick. And my father lives off the garbage! The king offered me much in gold and I have a litter of brothersâ€¦
Whoa...whoa...whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa!
Fionaâ€™s father paid you to do this?
The rich King? SÃ­.
Well, so much for Dadâ€™s royal blessing.
Oh, come on, Shrek, donâ€™t feel bad. Almost everybody that meets you wants to kill you.
Gee, thanks. (sighs) Maybe Fiona wouldâ€™ve been better off if I were some sort of Prince Charming.
SÃ­, thatâ€™s what the King said.
Oh, uhâ€¦ sorry. I thought that question was directed at me.
Shrek, Fiona knows youâ€™d do anything for her.
Well, itâ€™s not like I wouldnâ€™t change if I could. I justâ€¦ I just wish I could make her happy. [tiny pauses out] Hold the phoneâ€¦
"Happiness. A tear drop away." Donkey! Think of the saddest thing thatâ€™s ever happened to you.

Aw, man, where do I begin? Well, first there was the time that old farmer tried to sell me for some magic beans. I ain't never got over that. Then this fool went off and had a party and he have the guests trying to pin the tail on me. Then they got all drunk and start beating me with a stick going, "PiÃ±ata! PiÃ±ata!" What is a piÃ±ata, anyway?!
No, Donkey! I need you to cry!
Yeah, well donâ€™t go projecting on me! I know youâ€™re feeling bad, but you gotta let your own--
You little, hairy, litter-licking sack of...
Ohâ€¦

What? Is it on? Is it on? [clears throat] This is Fairy Godmother. Iâ€™m either away from my desk or with a client. But if you come by the office, weâ€™ll be glad to make you a personal appointment. Have a happy ever after.
Are you up for a little quest, Donkey?
Thatâ€™s more like it! Shrek and Donkey, on another whirlwind adventure! ðŸŽ¶Ainâ€™t no stopping us now! Whoo! Weâ€™re on the move!ðŸŽ¶
Stop, Ogre! I have misjudged you.
Join the club. Weâ€™ve got jackets.
On my honor, I am obliged to accompany you until I have saved your life as you have spared me mine.
I'm sorry, the position of annoying talking animals has already been taken. Letâ€™s go, Shrek! Shrek?
Shrek!
Aw, come on, Donkey. Look at himâ€¦ in his wee little boots. You know, how many cats can wear boots? Honestly. Aw, letâ€™s keep him!
Say what?!
I'm sorry, the position of annoying talking animals has already been taken. Letâ€™s go, Shrek! Shrek?
Shrek!
Aw, come on, Donkey. Look at himâ€¦ in his wee little boots. You know, how many cats can wear boots? Honestly. Aw, letâ€™s keep him!
Say what?!
Aw, listen. Heâ€™s purring!
Oh, so now itâ€™s cute!
Aw, come on, Donkey. Lighten up.
Lighten up? Oh, I should lighten up?! Look whoâ€™s telling who to lighten up!
[giggles] Shrek!
Shrek?
Theyâ€™re both festive, arenâ€™t they? What do you think, Harold?
Umâ€¦ yes, yes. Fine. Fine.
Try to at least pretend youâ€™re interested in your daughterâ€™s wedding ball.
Honestly, Lillian, I donâ€™t think it matters. How do we know there will even be a ball?
Mom! Dad!
Oh, hello, dear.
Whatâ€™s that, Cedric? Right! Coming!
Mom, have you seen Shrek?
I havenâ€™t. You should ask your father. Be sure and use small words, dear. Heâ€™s a little slow this morning.
Can I help you, Your Majesty?
Ah, yes! Umâ€¦
Mmm! Exquisite. What do you call this dish?
That would be the dogâ€™s breakfast, Your Majesty.
Ah, yes. Very good, then. Carry on, Cedric.
Dad? Dad, have you seen Shrek?
Uh, no I havenâ€™t, dear.
Iâ€™m sure he just went off to look for a niceâ€¦ mud hole to cool down in. You know, after your little spat last night.
Oh. You heard that, huh?
Darling, the whole kingdom heard you. I mean, after all, it is in his nature to beâ€¦well, a bit of a brute.
Him? You know, you didnâ€™t exactly roll out the Welcome Wagon!
Well, what did you expect?! Look at what heâ€™s done to you.
Shrek loves me for who I am. I would think youâ€™d be happy for me.
Darling, Iâ€™m just thinking about whatâ€™s best for you. Maybe you should do the same.
No, really?
Ohâ€¦
Oh, no. Thatâ€™s the ol' Keeblerâ€™s place! Letâ€™s just back away slowly.
Thatâ€™s the Fairy Godmotherâ€™s cottage. Sheâ€™s the largest producer of hexes and potions in the whole kingdom.
Then why donâ€™t we pop in there for a spell? Ha-ha! Spell!
He makes me laugh!
Hi. Iâ€™m here to see the--
The Fairy Godmother. Iâ€™m sorry. She is not in.
Jerome, coffee and a Monte Cristo. Now!
[sighs] Yes, Fairy Godmother. Right away. Look, sheâ€™s not seeing any clients today, okay?
Thatâ€™s okay, buddy. Weâ€™re from the union.
The union?
We represent the workers in all magical industries, both evil and benign.
Oh! Oh, right.
Are you feeling at all degraded or oppressed?
Uhâ€¦ a little. W--w--we donâ€™t even have dental.
They donâ€™t even have dental. Okay, we're just gonna have a look around. Oh. By the way. I think itâ€™d be better if the Fairy Godmother didnâ€™t know we were here. Know what Iâ€™m saying? Huh?
Hmm?
Huh?
Huh? Huh? Huh?!
Stop it.
(whispers) Of course. Go right in.
ðŸŽ¶A drop of desire!ðŸŽ¶[giggles] Naughty!
ðŸŽ¶A pinch of passion. ðŸŽ¶[laughs] ðŸŽ¶And just a hint ofâ€¦lust!ðŸŽ¶ [laughs]
Excuse me.
Sorry to barge in like this but uh--
What in Grimmâ€™s name are you doing here?
Well...it seems that Fionaâ€™s not exactly happy.
Oh-ho-ho! And thereâ€™s some question as to why that is? Well, letâ€™s explore that, shall we?
Ah. P, P, P, P, Pâ€¦Princess.
Cinderella! Here we are. "Lived happily ever after." Ohâ€¦[laughs] No ogres!
Letâ€™s see. Snow White. A handsome prince. Oh...no ogres.
Sleeping Beauty. Oh, no ogres! Hansel and Gretel? No! Thumbelina? No. The Golden Bird, the Little Mermaid, Pretty Womanâ€¦No, no, no, no, no!
You see, ogres donâ€™t live happily ever after.
All right, look, lady!
Donâ€™t you pointâ€¦ those dirty green sausages at me!
Your Monte Cristo and coffee--oh! Sorry.
Ahâ€¦ thatâ€™s okay. We were just leaving. Very sorry to have wasted your time, Miss Godmother.
Justâ€¦ go.
Come on, guys.
TGIF, eh, buddy? Working hard or hardly working, eh, Mac?
Oh! Eh!
Hey, man, you wanna get your fine Corinthian footwear and your cat cheeks out of my face? Man, that stinks!
